question_text:
Which of the following is a solution to the inequality below?
$-9 \geq p$
question_type: Multiple Choice Question with Single Answer
solution: Go through the answer choices one by one.

Plug $p=-2$ into the inequality.
$-9 \geq -2$
$-9 \geq -2$
It is false that $-9 \geq -2$. So, $p=-2$ is not a solution.

Plug $p=-12$ into the inequality.
$-9 \geq -12$
$-9 \geq -12$
It is true that $-9 \geq -12$. So, $p=-12$ is a solution.

Plug $p=-8$ into the inequality.
$-9 \geq -8$
$-9 \geq -8$
It is false that $-9 \geq -8$. So, $p=-8$ is not a solution.

Plug $p=-3$ into the inequality.
$-9 \geq -3$
$-9 \geq -3$
It is false that $-9 \geq -3$. So, $p=-3$ is not a solution.
Only $p=-12$ is a solution.

question_text:
Is $g = 12$ a solution to the inequality below?

$2 > g$
question_type: Multiple Choice Question with Single Answer
solution:
Plug $g=12$ into the inequality:
$2 > 12$
It is false that $2 > 12$. So, $g=12$ is not a solution.

question_text:
Is $k = 9$ a solution to the inequality below?

$17 > k$
question_type: Multiple Choice Question with Single Answer
solution:
Substitute $k = 9$ into the inequality:
$17 > 9$
It is true that $17 > 9$. So, $k=9$ is a solution.

question_text:
Which of the following is a solution to the inequality below?

$2 \leq n$
question_type: Multiple Choice Question with Single Answer
solution: The inequality $2 \leq n$ means n must be greater than or equal to 2.
Only $n = 2$ satisfies this condition.

question_text:
Which of the following is a solution to the inequality below?

$15 \leq n$
question_type: Multiple Choice Question with Single Answer
solution: The inequality $15 \leq n$ means n must be greater than or equal to 15.
Only $n = 22$ satisfies this condition.

question_text:

$8 < n$

solution:
Substitute $n = 10$ into the inequality:
$8 < 10$
It is true that $8 < 10$. So, $n=10$ is a solution.
